poem:
Mourning in the Streets

Bodies sway like grass  
under an oppressive sun—  
the dust of voices rises,  
echoing through alleys.  

In the jumbled breaths  
of a city in turmoil,  
both blood and tears  
pose the same question:  
  
who can mend the shattered sky  
when even prayers  
are trampled underfoot?
